title: Microtropis fascicularis
text: Microtropis fascicularis is a species of <a href="plant">plant</a> in the family <a href="Celastraceae">Celastraceae</a>. It is <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> to <a href="Borneo">Borneo</a> where it is confined to <a href="Sarawak">Sarawak</a>. It is a <a href="deciduous">deciduous</a> <a href="shrub">shrub</a> normally ranging in height from 1–5 m, though sometimes it can scramble higher into the crowns of taller trees. Its stems are covered with small, sharp, hooked spines, which aid it in climbing. The <a href="leaf">leaves</a> are <a href="pinnate">pinnate</a>, with 5-7 leaflets. The <a href="flower">flower</a>s are usually pale pink, but can vary between a deep pink and white. They are 4–6 cm diameter with five petals, and mature into an oval 1.5–2 cm red-orange <a href="fruit">fruit</a>.
